semantic_identifier: 80: feat: Issue model: add standardized Attribution Evidence fields + audit trail

sections.text:
## Description

This PR introduces a lightweight, structured “Attribution Evidence” section on Issue objects to capture attribution inputs consistently and keep them auditable over time.

Changes:
- Schema/model: adds new optional fields on `Issue` for attribution evidence:
  - `impactedAccountIds` (array of account identifiers)
  - `revenueAtRiskCents` (integer, currency in minor units)
  - `expectedImpactHypothesis` (text)
  - `downstreamWorkIds` (array of strings; e.g., Jira/Linear/Salesforce IDs)
- API: extends Issue read/write endpoints to accept/return an `attributionEvidence` object; validates types and basic constraints (non-negative revenue, max lengths for text, deduped arrays).
- Auditing: persists an immutable change log entry whenever `attributionEvidence` is created/updated (who/when, before/after diff) so later reporting/disputes can reference historical values.
- UI: adds an “Attribution Evidence” panel on the Issue detail page with edit controls behind existing Issue edit permissions.
- Backfill/migration: migration adds nullable columns/JSON field (depending on storage) with no required backfill; existing Issues remain unaffected until populated.
- Tests: adds unit tests for validation and audit logging + API contract tests for serialization.

Notes for reviewers/users:
- Fields are optional and non-blocking (low priority change; no workflow gating).
- The new data is intended as a source-of-truth baseline; reporting can be built on top in follow-ups.
- No breaking changes: existing clients continue to work; new fields are additive.

## How Has This Been Tested?
